claim: Flublok is produced using a novel production platform in which recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells using a baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS).

verified_evidence.quote: It contains purified ha proteins produced in a continuous insect cell line (expresSF+®) that is derived rom Sf9 cells of the fall army worm, Spodoptera frug i per da (which is related to moths, caterpillars and butterflies), and grown in serum free medium composed of chemically- defined lipids, vitamins, amino acids, and mineral salts. Each of the three HAs is d ihi ll li i b l i (A hlif i l expressed in this cell line using abaculo virus vector (Autograph a cali for nica nuclear polyhedrosis virus), extracted from the cells with Triton X-100 and further purified by column chromatography.

verified_evidence.quote: Flublok [Influenza Vaccine] is a sterile clear colorless injection containing recombina hemagglutinin (HA) proteins from three influenza viruses for intramuscular use. It contains purified ha proteins produced in a continuous insect cell line (expresSF+®) that is derived rom Sf9 cells of the fall army worm, Spodoptera frug i per da (which is related to moths, caterpillars and butterflies), and grown in serum free medium composed of chemically- defined lipids, vitamins, amino acids, and mineral salts.
verified_evidence.explanation: A very similar quote appears in the document on page 3: 'Flublok [Influenza Vaccine] is a sterile clear colorless injection containing recombina hemagglutinin (HA) proteins from three influenza viruses for intramuscular use. It contains purified ha proteins produced in a continuous insect cell line (expresSF+®) that is derived rom Sf9 cells of the fall army worm, Spodoptera frug i per da (which is related to moths, caterpillars and butterflies), and grown in serum free medium composed of chemically- defined lipids, vitamins, amino acids, and mineral salts.' The wording is nearly identical to the quote to verify, with only minor typographical differences (e.g., 'recombina' instead of 'recombinant', 'rom' instead of 'from', and some spacing issues).. The quote directly supports the claim. It states that Flublok contains recombinant hemagglutinin (HA) proteins produced in a continuous insect cell line (expresSF+®) derived from Sf9 cells of Spodoptera frugiperda. This matches the claim that Flublok is produced using a novel platform in which recombinant HA is expressed in insect cells. While the quote does not explicitly mention the baculovirus expression vector system (BEVS), the document elsewhere (page 3) states: 'expressed in this cell line using abaculo virus vector (Autograph a cali for nica nuclear polyhedrosis virus)...' This confirms the use of BEVS. Therefore, the quote, together with the surrounding context, genuinely supports the claim.

new_evidence.quote: Each 0.5 mL dose of Flublok may also contain residual amounts of baculo virus and Spodoptera frugiperda cell proteins (≤14.3 mcg), baculo virus and cellular DNA (≤10 ng), and Triton X-100 (≤100 mcg).
new_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote provides evidence that baculovirus and insect cell components are present in the final product, supporting the claim that Flublok is produced using a baculovirus expression vector system in insect cells.
